messages.title: My pledges to you
messages.content: To bring new jobs to our area. To give local people the skills they need to get to work. To fight for older people to have the care they deserve. To make sure our children get the best start in life.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: To bring new jobs to our area and ensure that older people get the care they deserve.
To keep up the investment in Sure Start Children’s Centres and new school buildings.
To create a National Care Service that is free when we need it.
Always to put you and your family first.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only Labour and the Tories have any chance of winning in South Thanet, so voting Liberal Democrat or for any other party is a wasted vote.

issues.economy: I will never stop selling what our area has to offer to investors.
issues.education: To keep up our investment in Sure Start Children’s Centres and new school buildings.
issues.governance: Always to put you and your family first. Since 1997 your problems have been my problems and that is the way it will stay.
issues.health: To fight for older people to get the care they deserve. To create a National Care Service that is free when we need it.
issues.socialWelfare: To fight for older people to have the care they deserve.

leaflet.personalStatement: I came to this area in 1990 to live and work and have been campaigning on local issues ever since.

politicalExperience.achievements: Rebuilding programme for all our local secondary schools, improvement of the NHS and the rollout of neighbourhood policing.
Rebuilding programme for all our local secondary schools, improvement of the NHS and the rollout of neighbourhood policing.

endorsements.endorsement: Stephen Ladyman has done a great job as our MP, so if you don't want to see the clock turned back in South Thanet it has to be Labour again this time.

images.caption: Photo of Dr Stephen Ladyman with another individual.
